block.p: Sharon Lyu Volckhausen, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William A. Volckhausen of Brooklyn, was married yesterday in Princeton, N.J., to John David Buretta, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald B. Buretta of Fresno, Calif. The Rev. Joseph C. Williamson, a United Church of Christ minister performed the ceremony at the Princeton University Chapel, where he is the Dean.

Sharon Lyu Volckhausen, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William A. Volckhausen of Brooklyn, was married yesterday in Princeton, N.J., to John David Buretta, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald B. Buretta of Fresno, Calif. The Rev. Joseph C. Williamson, a United Church of Christ minister performed the ceremony at the Princeton University Chapel, where he is the Dean.
The bride, a Princeton graduate, and the bridegroom, a alumnus of the University of California at Berkeley, received law degrees from Georgetown University.

The bride, 28, who received a master's degree in history from Oxford University, completed a clerkship last month at Federal District Court in New York. In November, she is to become an associate at Simpson Thacher & Bartlett, the New York law firm.

Her mother, known professionally as Grace Lyu-Volckhausen, is the director of community outreach for New York State's Housing Finance and Mortgage Agencies in Manhattan. The bride's father retired as a senior vice president and senior counsel at the Dime Savings Bank in New York.

The bridegroom, 25, is an associate at the New York law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore. His mother, Stephanie A. Buretta, is the auction manager at KMTF-TV, the public television station in Fresno. His father is the vice president and controller at David & Sons, a confectionary manufacturer in Fresno.
